Interface Model

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MockModel, ModelImpl
    public interface Model
    This is an interface for stock model. Contains all the data-related logic that the user requires.

    • Method Summary

      • getPortfolio

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> getPortfolio()
        Given a portfolio, return a map of the portfolio's holdings, where the key is the company name and the value is a list of lists, where each inner list is a list of the holding's attributes.
        Returns:
        A HashMap with a String as the key and a List of List of Strings as the value.

      • setPortfolio

        void setPortfolio​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> portfolio)
        It sets the portfolio of the user.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - A HashMap of the portfolio. The key is the name of the portfolio, and the value is a list of lists.

      • addsFinalDataToPortfolio

        void addsFinalDataToPortfolio​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> dataToAdd,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String currentDate)
        This function takes in a list of lists of strings, a string, and a string, and adds the data to the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        dataToAdd - A list of lists of strings. Each list of strings represents a row of data.
        name - The name of the portfolio you want to add data to.
        currentDate - The current date in the format of "MM/dd/yyyy"

        Given a string, return true if it's a valid date in the format YYYY-MM-DD, otherwise return false.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A boolean value.

      • getTotalStockValue

        double getTotalStockValue​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                          java.lang.String currentDate)
        "Given a portfolio name and a date, return the total value of all the stocks in the portfolio on that date." The function is a bit more complicated than the previous ones. It takes two parameters: a portfolio name and a date. It returns a double, which is the total value of all the stocks in the portfolio on that date
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The name of the portfolio for which the total stock value is to be calculated.
        currentDate - The date for which the total stock value is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        The total value of the stocks in the portfolio.

      • getPortfolioSize

        Gets the size of portfolio.
        Returns:
        the size of portfolio

        Returns:
        A boolean value.

        month - The month of the year (1-12)
        year - The year of the date.
